text: This is a pretty cafe located in the heart of Colombo and has a very beautiful ambience. The atmosphere was calm.This was my first visit to Barefoot for an exhibition. One should go here if you wanna just relax and chill with your friends.Overall, it is a great place. Very friendly staff. Excellent food and great service. I would say that it is one of the places that provide really tasty food in Colombo.Definitely i would visit again - but just make sure not to sit next to those Industrial fans which could blow your head right off :). But it was great.
title: CHILLING WITH FRIENDS

text: This quirky venue will meet most needs:- great selection of food- drinks galore, plus cocktails to boot- happy hour 17.00 - 19.00- excellent art gallery & art for sale- gift shop that is probably the best in the whole of Colombo based on variety, quality & style
title: Lunch & a bit of shopping

text: Excellent food and great service. A visit to Barefoot is always a pleasure and it never disappoints. And to finish off a good meal, there's always the shop .... perfect way to spend an afternoon!
title: Always a pleasure

text: 逛街逛到累了，便去了很多旅遊書都有介紹的這間Barefoot Cafe。 本來想試試斯里蘭卡的咖喱雞，可是當天沒有關門所以點了煎魚和mixed dip platter. 食物不錯，但在當地水平是很貴的一餐。 很喜歡這種環境，很chill，佷relaxed! 食完還可以逛逛他們自家的精品店，買當地設計師Sansoni 的家品文具等。
title: 很Chill and relaxed 的一餐

text: After walking through the shop (which is absolutely wonderful!) you can reach the secret garden where there's a restaurant/café. It offers simple but traditional recipes and prices are not too expensive. I suggest this place!
title: A secret garden

text: I only had some juice but will be back for more! Lovely service and the best ambiance I have seen in Colombo. There were tourists and it is a bit more pricey than local cafes but it is a really nice experience and low price compared to Europe. I came to chat with friends and this was a great place for it. The shop in the front is something you have to see along with the fully functioning loom that was being used when we were there. It is also refreshing to not have to barter or argue with waiters when you are over-charged which is common in Sri Lanka. They are honest.
title: Great cafe and store, a "must visit" in Colombo.

text: A cafe hidden in the busy centre of Colombo. The store also has a few teas and handloom artefacts. Reasonably priced place where we spent the last few hours before heading to the airport to catch our flight
title: Beautiful cafe

text: Had a nice lunch; nothing fancy but very nice. Also some interesting shopping; some souvenirs that you might not in the average tourist trap.
title: Nice place to visit for lunch and souvenirs

text: Dropped in for a coffee and loved the tranquil outdoor setting. Great ambience. Attentive professional service and allow time (and money) to explore the store
title: Expat Oasis and great souvenir shopping

text: Had lunch here, the pepper chicken quiche and side salad were quite amazing! A must when visiting Colombo! Don’t forget the Barefoot store for your souvenir needs!! Cool place to visit!
title: Wonderful quiche

text: We couldn’t visit Sri Lanka without a visit to the Barefoot Garden Cafe. It’s a perfect place to chill out after a shopping spree in their wonderful shop! Although we visit twice a year we always find something to buy! Dominic Sansoni has become a friend and the beer is always cold at Barefoot. You just must visit!
title: A must do if you’re in Colombo!

text: We were looking for a restaurant that could chill out in the weekend. We found that bare foot could meet this requirement even though the reviews indicate it’s a café. The aroma as we came in the door was so delicious and inviting. The tables had simple authentic Sri Lankan touch amenities. We order some falafel warp and drinks but as I am living in Middle East, I never thought that they will serve delicious falafel same as the Arab countries. The food is really tasty and well prepared.Service was attentive and friendly. Refills of water were frequent and staff removed empty plates without disrupting the conversation. The restaurant is both quaint and small but patrons seemed to have space for comfortable conversation. The building next to restaurant itself giving an authentic look where they sell handcraft items. This restaurant is worth the visit.
title: A Lovely Place to chill out

text: We visited this oasis on the Ramadan national holiday when the museums were closed.Great for shopping for local craft but also an oasis with a spacious well patronised outdoor low key restaurant. Prices were very reasonable and we can recommend the milkshakes made with real cow's milk rather than with sweetened condensed milk as at some other places.
title: Great shopping and food options

text: Excellent choice of food. Very friendly and helpful staff. Its open for lunch and may be an early dinner.
title: Very good

text: Recently visited with some friends. The restaurant was busy, although it was a weekday (lunch time). Staff were friendly, especially the manager. Food was also good, served warm and quick. A bit expensive but worth it. Potions are also reasonably large. Would recommend this place.
title: Nice atmosphere, friendly staff & good food !!

text: It is not very often that you can find a place to hang out enjoy a great coffee and that also offers great food. Well, Barefoot offers both and a good service too. There is something else about this place and it is the atmosphere where you feel welcomed and among friends.Sunday's with a live band are a special treat and very much recommended!
title: great place to hang out

text: We visited Barefoot after reading trip advisor reviews and weren’t disappointed. The cafe is in a hidden courtyard out the back of their shop. They had live music when we visited which added to the atmosphere. Lots of options for food from sandwiches to curry or pasta. We had the soy sauce pork sandwich and pulled chicken sandwich. Both were tasty, bread was fresh and we washed it down with a nice cold Lion lager. Worth the stop for a nice lunch and escape from the hustle and bustle
title: Hidden garden cafe in the middle of Colombo

text: I love this place with its friendly, professional and efficient service. Even the owner was hands on. The food is good and the price in relation to quality correct. Last Sunday was a special nice atmosphere with a lovely live band filling the yard with a beautiful atmosphere. Will be back!
title: Lovely food in great atmosphere

text: Barefoot Garden Cafe is an ideal place for a lunch meeting or meetings over a drink and a snack, The food and drinks are fabulous and competitively priced. Portions are generous and service good.The arty environment of Barefoot gallery offers a distinctive experience and provide a glimpse of the best of the Sri Lankan Handloom industry . The art gallery takes visitors to another level of experience with exhibitions.Barefoot Cafe is also a fabulous venue for parties and art related events in the nights . A unique experience is offered under the canopy of stars and the dark night illuminated with fire torches.
title: Fabulous Food in an arty environment

text: There was on Sunday afternoon a nice concert. The place is nice and relaxing. But at 17.30 it was already not anymore possible to order food and at 19h they close already. So you can only use it for lunch or afternoon drinks!
title: Nice place with odd opening hours
